front.title: Advertising Link and Node Security Properties in OSPF/IS-IS

abstract.t: This document defines a way for an Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) or IS-IS router to advertise different security states at node and/or link granularity. Such advertisements allow entities (e.g., centralized controllers) to determine whether a particular node/link or path meets security policies that have to be enforced. Here, the term "OSPF" means both OSPFv2 and OSPFv3.
